Articles.Content:
Hi guys

I watched Scott Manley on youtube and Ive noticed one thing

I saw him disconnect stuff off one of his ships and he connected it to a different ship (solar panel I think)

I tried to do it myself but when I EVA I dont have that option, I can only open and close it.

What am I doing wrong?

Macko,

I have no idea, but I'm definitely intrigued!

Which video was this in?

-Slashy

I am not entirely sure

He was connecting stuff to an asteroid

http://youtu.be/i-ArwCbkgDk?t=19m

found it

Edited July 31, 2014 by Macko939
You need mods. Google up "Scott Manley favourite mods" and you should find something useful.
The technique is using a thing called a 'Mass Relay'. It moves things. Pretty fast actually.

Sorry, I know this is obvious but I can't resist it: "Moar Boosters"

You have the best answer - KAS.
I wish Kerbal Attachment System functionality was part of core KSP - it fits SO well with KSP.
^ i could not agree more. Same with Kerbal Alarm Clock

unfortunately KAS is not currently compatible with .24. Read backwards on the forum topic as the mod author has currently allowed crowd-sourced modifications in an attempt to return its functionality. Otherwise, you could load .23.5 which is very fully compatible with the current stock version of KAS and toy with that.

^ i could not agree more. Same with Kerbal Alarm Clock

Emphatically seconded. KAC takes nothing away from the game except for time-acceleration-induced irritation.

Emphatically seconded. KAC takes nothing away from the game except for time-acceleration-induced irritation.

Exactly - i found i tended to focus on a single mission, and it became tedious babysitting simple satellite or probe missions waiting for a SOI change which i would nearly ALWAYS miss or time accel through. KAC allows multiple missions without the stress.
It's called kerbal attachment system google it.
I think he gets that its KAS. Sometimes, the dead horse has been kicked so much, it was tenderized into delicious "beef", but this was more like ground "beef". Yeah, I'm looking at you England.

I wish Kerbal Attachment System functionality was part of core KSP - it fits SO well with KSP.

After seeing the bang up job they did with the toolbar, I would prefer they didn't add any features from a beloved mod.
